core.tut.pori.http.parameters

Class HTTPParameter

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.tut.pori.http.parameters.HTTPParameter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanParameter, DataGroups, DoubleParameter, InputStreamParameter, IntegerParameter, Limits, LongParameter, QueryParameter, SortOptions, StringParameter

    public abstract class HTTPParameter
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for custom HTTP Parameters. Even though the built-in parameter types should work for most cases, there might rise a need for a case-specific way to parse a given method parameter, this class is for those needs.

    • Method Detail

      • initializeRaw

        public void initializeRaw(java.lang.String parameterValue)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Initialize the parameter by raw URL encoded string. This can be overridden to intercept the URL encoded parameter, the default implementation decodes the string and calls initialize()
        Parameters:
        parameterValue -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • initialize

        Parameters:
        parameterValue - can be null

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.io.InputStream parameterValue)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Initialize this parameter based on input stream Override this method if you want to accept HTTP Body data. The default implementation only throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        parameterValue - can be null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - on bad input data

      • hasValues

        public abstract boolean hasValues()
        Returns:
        true if this parameter has one or more values

      • getValue

        public abstract java.lang.Object getValue()
        Returns:
        a single value object or null if none available
